result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Raymond Connors was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$200 in bail bond has been dispursed to the Victim in this matter as partial payment of the Restitution.
The Court orders payments to DOC at the rate of $150/month.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for good time credit.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Burnett County case 15CT50

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Raymond Connors

records.addlTxt:
09:48 AM Cases 15CM172, 15CT50, and 20CF256 called together.  Defendant Richard R. Connors in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  Jeffrey Robert Kohler appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM172 and 15CT50 on for sentencing hearing after revocation.  Case 20CF256 is on for restitution hearing.  State calls first witness, who is sworn in and testifies.  State has Exhibit 1: Duffy Bill and Exhibit 02: Restitution Supplement marked, offered- no objection, and received.  Atty Harrington crosses.  Atty Kohler redirects.  No further questions.  Witness steps down.  Defense calls defendant, who is sworn in and testifies.  No questions from DA for this witness.  No further witnesses.  Atty Kohler argues, Atty Harrington objects- clarification made; argues for restitution in the amount supported by Exhibit 01: Duffy Bill.  Atty Harrington argues there's no direct causation to support the restitution request.  Def stipulates to hydraulic hose, front engine cover, and quick coupler.  Atty Kohler enters rebuttal, asking for joint/several responsibility.  Atty Harrington concedes joint/several responsibility, still contests causation.  Court to take restituion under advisement, will issue a decision next week.  Cases 15CM172 and 15CT50 proceed to SEHR.  Atty Harrington notes jail credit is approximately 230 days.  Parties acknowledge receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant (ROAW).  State argues for sentencing consistent with ROAW, stipulates to jail credit of 220 days.  Defense attorney argues for sentencing consistent with ROAW.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders: 
15CM172: 9 months jail.  
15CT50: 9 months and 14 days jail.
(214 days jail total)
Good time eligible, concurrent, 220 days jail credit (time served).   A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Appeal rights provided.
DNA to be provided to the Sheriff's Department prior to leaving the building.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 26, 2021 at 09:45 am.
Probation review hearing on November 13, 2020 at 02:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on November 13, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Restitution paid to Richard E. Thompson

Defendant, Richard R. Connors, appeared with Attorney Gail Marie Metheny.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State. Case recalled. ADA resites the agreement 15CM172 plead to theft. 1 yr prob. rest. $600 successfull completion of the IDIP, 15CT50, 60 days Jail $guideline fine and Rev.  AODA and Ig Interlock all others DRI . Restricted controlled substance. Defense agrees, Atty Metheny files PLQ. The Court examines Def. understands and waives his constitutional rights, JT waived, believes the state has enough evidence to prove his G, understands the Court could sentence him to the max, states that he is G because he is G, acknowledges that he has been convicted of OWI 3 times previous. Agrees that the facts in the PC are accurate in both cases. No good time on the 60 days. The Court examines ATTY Metheny. in 17CM172 Def. enters G plea and in 15CT50 count 1 enters G plea, KIV entered, the Court finds FB for plea and finds him G of the 2 charges. Count 2 of this case is merged and dismisssed. ADA requests 1 yr probation withheld, completion of IDIP and pay restitution. Atty Metheny agrees and addresses the Court. Def enters aloq. in 15CM172 w/holds sentence 1 yr probation, Rest. $600.00 in 15CT50 sentence withheld 1 yr probation, 60 days jail condition of probation , complete IDIP, AODA,   Maintain Absolute Sobriety. $1,744.00 Rev. for 27 mo.   Report immediately, Huber @ the Jail's discretion. Can serve elsewhere @ no cost to Burnett Co. Early release from probation if all terms have been met. 16 days jail credit. the Court orders payments of $150/month

Defendant, Richard Raymond Connors, appeared with Attorney Gail Marie Metheny.  Attorney William Lund Norine appeared for the State. Agreement has been reached, working on details. Set for plea/sentencing.

Defendant, Richard Raymond Connors, appeared with Attorney Gail Marie Metheny.  Attorney William Lund Norine appeared for the State. Atty Metheny unsure if she will be assigned to his cases long term but she is here to assist him today. Status has been scheduled.

Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer in court.  William Lund Norine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant fails to appear. Court grants motion to withdraw to Atty Moldenhauer. Court issues warrant for failure to appear. Back on the record at 10:34 am. Defendant appears. Warrant is quashed. State gives def. offer letter to review. Def to contact PD office re: new public defender. Status set for 9/26/17. Defendant personally given Notice of Hearing with next hearing date.
